info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 4:18PM EDT until June 2 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kendall, The Redland, Doral, Sweetwater, Kendale Lakes, Tamiami, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, The Hammocks, Miccosukee Resort, West Kendall, The Crossings, University Park, Sunset, Country Walk, Fountainbleau, Olympia Heights, Westchester, Richmond West, Everglades National Park and Kendall West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING
